means: 便宜而俗艳的服装，无用的东西

sentence.Network_en: Affections of manner and speech are mere frippery.
sentence.Network_cn: 态度和语言的做作只是矫饰而已.

sentence.Network_en: Affectations of manner and speech are mere frippery.
sentence.Network_cn: 态度和语言的做作只是俗丽服饰而已.

sentence.Network_en: She often wears ornaments of frippery.
sentence.Network_cn: 她常戴些低俗的装饰品.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting old or second-hand clothes): from French friperie, from Old French freperie, from frepe 'rag', of unknown ultimate origin

entry.tran: 俗丽的装饰;无用的玩意儿;华而不实之物
entry.def: If you refer to something as frippery, you mean that it is silly or unnecessary, and only done or worn for pleasure

example.ex: ...all the fripperies with which the Edwardian woman indulged herself.
example.tran: 这个爱德华七世时期的女人披挂上身的所有那些俗丽的饰品

example.ex: ...a sombre display, with no frills or frippery.
example.tran: 没有多余或虚华的装饰的朴实的展示

means.word_mean: 1. something of little value or significance
